author: √öltimas Noticias
title: Iran condemns US threat to reimpose sanctions on Venezuela - √öltimas Noticias
text: Iran condemns the new threat from the United States against Venezuela and reiterates that the ‚Äúuse of sanctions as a weapon‚Äù violates the principles of International Law, Foreign Ministry spokesperson Naser Kanani said this Thursday. ‚ÄúThe use of sanctions as a weapon by the United States against other countries violates the rights of governments and nationals, human rights and the principles of International Law,‚Äù Kanani stressed in response to Washington's threats to resume unilateral embargoes. against the oil and mining industry of Venezuela, refers [Hispan TV](https://www.hispantv.com/noticias/politica/579108/iran-venezuela-sanciones-eeuu). Likewise, the spokesman for Persian diplomacy made it clear that the use of unilateral coercive measures will only strengthen the will of sovereign countries to counteract, together, the interventionist policies of the United States. ‚ÄúResorting to such measures amounts to direct intervention in the internal affairs of countries and a violation of the Charter of the United Nations, so their continuation will increase the will and cooperation of independent countries to resist such interventionist policies.‚Äù ‚ÄùKanani added. For his part, Foreign Minister Yv√°n Gil thanked Iran for its support to the country, which adds to the condemnations expressed from different parts of the world to the imperial attack. ‚ÄúThe brotherly Government of the Islamic Republic of Iran joins the global condemnation of the imperial threats against Venezuela. ‚ÄúWorld solidarity in favor of La Paz, thank you!‚Äù Gil published on the X social network. The brother Government of the Islamic Republic of Iran üáÆüá∑ joins the global condemnation of the imperial threats against Venezuela üáªüá™. Global solidarity in favor of La Paz Thank you!- Yvan Gil (@yvangil) [#AntiimperialistFebruary] [pic.twitter.com/RzeWH2PDre] [February 1, 2024] The statements by the Persian diplomat come after the United States announced on Tuesday that it ‚Äúwill not renew‚Äù as of April, a license granted in support of the Barbados Agreement, agreed in October between the opposition and the Government of President Nicol√°s Maduro, in response to the 15-year disqualification of the opposition presidential candidate, Mar√≠a Corina Machado, for coup attempts. El [Venezuelan government](https://en.ultimasnoticias.com.ve/news/politics/Venezuela-rejects-blackmail-from-the-US-in-the-country%27s-internal-affairs/) He described the threat as clear interference in internal affairs, and a new attempt to destabilize the country's politics and economy.
